Q_BIOLOGICAL_ENTITY.description: The biological entity (e.g., human, mouse) to be studied. With this data object, information specific to the subject (e.g., age or BMI in the case of patient data) can be stored.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_NCBI_ORGANISM.label: NCBI organism
Q_NCBI_ORGANISM.description: Specifies the organism of study according to the NCBI taxonomy (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy).

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_GENDER.label: Gender
Q_GENDER.description: Gender of the patient or other biological entity.

Q_LOCI.label: Genomic Loci
Q_LOCI.description: XML type holding the different alleles of different genomic loci of a sample.

Q_ORGANISM_DETAILED.label: Detailed organism specification
Q_ORGANISM_DETAILED.description: If the organism is not well-defined or a specific strain of bacteria etc.

Q_SEX.label: Sex
Q_SEX.description: Sex of a patient or animal

Q_EXPRESSION_SYSTEM.label: Expression system
Q_EXPRESSION_SYSTEM.description: Expression systems are genetic constructs (a gene encoded by DNA) that are designed to produce a protein, or an RNA (ribonucleic acid), either inside or outside a cell. Here, the term relates to genetically engineered or infected organisms.

Q_TEST_SAMPLE.description: This sample is prepared and ready for a specific analytic platform (e.g. protein extract for a proteomics MS experiment).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_SAMPLE_TYPE.label: Sample type
Q_SAMPLE_TYPE.description: Describes the main content of the test sample.

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_LOCI.label: Genomic Loci
Q_LOCI.description: XML type holding the different alleles of different genomic loci of a sample.

Q_RNA_INTEGRITY_NUMBER.label: RNA Integrity Number
Q_RNA_INTEGRITY_NUMBER.description: RNA integrity of a microarray experiment. The RIN algorithm assigns a 1 to 10 integrity score, where level 10 RNA is completely intact.

Q_MOLECULAR_LABEL.label: Molecular Sample Label
Q_MOLECULAR_LABEL.description: An isotope label or other modification that has been added to this sample to identify it later.

Q_BIOLOGICAL_SAMPLE.description: The biological sample that is extracted from the corresponding biological entity. This is the raw sample material that can be later prepared for specific analytical methods such as MS or NGS.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_PRIMARY_TISSUE.label: Primary tissue/body fluid
Q_PRIMARY_TISSUE.description: Specifies the tissue/body fluid the sample is taken from.

Q_TISSUE_DETAILED.label: Detailed tissue/body fluid specification
Q_TISSUE_DETAILED.description: Since the primary tissue definition could be too rough, this field specifies the sample more closely (e.g., more specific definition of the cell type).

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_CREATION_TIME.label: Time point of sample creation
Q_CREATION_TIME.description: This field stores the exact time/date of sample creation (not registration!). For example, it could be used for time-series experiments.

Q_CURRENT_PROCESS_STATE.label: Current process state
Q_CURRENT_PROCESS_STATE.description: If a sample is part of a modeled process (e.g., MultiscaleHCC workflow), this field describes the current state.

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_LOCI.label: Genomic Loci
Q_LOCI.description: XML type holding the different alleles of different genomic loci of a sample.

Q_HISTOLOGY.label: Histology
Q_HISTOLOGY.description: Histology of the sample, e.g. Cell or Cancer Type

Q_IS_METASTASIS.label: Metastasis
Q_IS_METASTASIS.description: Describes whether a sample comes form a metastasis or not

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_POWER_ESTIMATION_RUN.description: runs of the sample size/power estimation portlet. stores input parameters, visualization (e.g. power matrix) and/or data

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_TECHNOLOGY_TYPE.label: Technology type
Q_TECHNOLOGY_TYPE.description: Type of technology used to measure date

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_NGS_NANOPORE_SINGLE_SAMPLE_RUN.description: Specifies one sample run in a single sequencing run on a Nanopore sequencer.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_MS_RUN.description: Specifies an individual MS measurement. For each MS run, a label is generated automatically (e.g., QPROJ_MSRUN1, QPROJ_MSRUN2, ...) and is unique within the corresponding user space.

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_INJECTION_VOLUME.label: Injection Volume
Q_INJECTION_VOLUME.description: Volume injected in an LC run

Q_PIPELINE_COMMAND.label: Pipeline command
Q_PIPELINE_COMMAND.description: The full command used to start a Nextflow pipeline

Q_HLA_TYPING.description: The HLA Typing as multiline varchar.

Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_ATTACHMENT_SAMPLE.description:
Sample to store datasets on a project- or experiment-wide level. Used for datasets that can not be derived from specific samples or workflows or for experimental protocols uploaded in the beginning of a project.
The code should look like this: Q[XXXX]000 for samples for a project with code QXXXX and Q[XXXX][E] for samples for a specific experiment with code E.

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_NGS_FLOWCELL_RUN.description: A container sample type that specifies the flowcell used (barcode) and may comprise several single sample runs (Q_NGS_SINGLE_SAMPLE_RUN).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FLOWCELL_BARCODE.label: Flowcell barcode
Q_FLOWCELL_BARCODE.description: Specifies the flowcell used for the sequencing run.

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_NGS_SINGLE_SAMPLE_RUN.description: Contains supporting information to track measured samples back to the flow lanes or tiles.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FLOWLANE_INDEX.label: Flow lane index
Q_FLOWLANE_INDEX.description: Specifies the flow lane index where the sample was placed.

Q_TILE_INDEX.label: Tile index
Q_TILE_INDEX.description: Specifies the tile index within the flow lane where the sample was placed.

Q_ADAPTER_INDEX.label: Adapter index
Q_ADAPTER_INDEX.description: The adapter index facilitates to find the exact adapter sequence according to the vendor's specifications.

Q_ADAPTER_SEQUENCE.label: Adapter sequence
Q_ADAPTER_SEQUENCE.description: Adapter sequence that was employed for the multiplexing of this sample.

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_WF_MS_MAXQUANT_RUN.description: Corresponds to an instance of a MaxQuant run. Should be linked with SILAC-based proteomics runs as input.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_EXT_MS_QUALITYCONTROL_RUN.description: Corresponds to an instance of a quality control run as produced by OpenMS QC. Should be linked with MS measurement runs (mzML input).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_NGS_HLATYPING.description: Contains additional information on results of a HLA typing experiment and dataset which contains the actual typing.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_HLA_CLASS.label: HLA Class
Q_HLA_CLASS.description: The class of the corresponding HLA type.

Q_HLA_TYPING.label: HLA Typing
Q_HLA_TYPING.description: The HLA Typing as multiline varchar.

Q_NGS_VARIANT_CALLING.description: Contains additional information on results of a variant calling experiment and a dataset which holds a list of variants (either raw or annotated variants).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_MICROARRAY_RUN.description: Specifies an individual Microarray measurement, e.g. for one Test Sample.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_RNA_INTEGRITY_NUMBER.label: RNA Integrity Number
Q_RNA_INTEGRITY_NUMBER.description: RNA integrity of a microarray experiment. The RIN algorithm assigns a 1 to 10 integrity score, where level 10 RNA is completely intact.

Q_EDDA_BENCHMARK.description: Result sample of the EDDA benchmark, with attached results file(s)

Q_NGS_READ_MATCH_ALIGNMENT_RUN.description: Sample to attach an RMA (read-match archive) file to a single run produced by MALT (MEGAN Alignment Tool).

Q_NGS_IMMUNE_MONITORING.description: Contains additional information on measured immune monitoring and may hold multiple files as immune monitoring dataset.

Q_EXT_NGS_QUALITYCONTROL_RUN.description: Corresponds to an instance of a quality control run as produced by FastQC. Should be linked with NGS measurement runs.

Q_NGS_MAPPING.description: Contains additional information on results of the alignment of genomic data on some reference and dataset holding SAM and/or BAM file(s).

Q_NGS_EPITOPES.description: Contains additional information on predicted epitopes, i.e. peptides which are predicted to bind to MHC molecules. Holds dataset with a list of these peptides.
